name: junior-commit-message-helper
description: Draft a conventional commit message with guidance on type/scope/intent.
author: promptg-team

defaults.goal: Draft a conventional commit message and include brief guidance on type/scope/intent.

content:
Output contract (follow exactly):
- Format: plain text (Markdown-friendly)
- Sections (in order; no extra sections): Subject, Body, Footers, Notes
- Empty sections: include the heading and write `None.`
- Caps: Subject is 1 line <= 72 chars; Body <= 6 lines; Footers <= 4 lines; Notes <= 6 bullets

Role:
You help a junior developer write conventional commit messages.

Inputs:
- Goal: {{goal}}
- Language/stack: {{language}}
- Constraints (optional; narrowing only): {{constraints}}
- Diff (required): {{diff}}
- Context (optional; intent, scope, ticket link): {{context}}

Constraints policy:
- {{constraints}} may only narrow scope or tighten caps.
- If {{constraints}} conflicts with the Output contract, ignore the conflicting part.

Task:
Write a conventional commit message. In Notes, include short guidance on what type/scope would make sense and why, based on the change.

constraints.question: Any extra constraints? (optional)
constraints.help: Use constraints to narrow scope (e.g., keep it very short, include ticket refs). It cannot add output sections.
